title: Wingstop stock rises after earnings beat, guidance raised
text: Wingstop Inc. WING, -2.06% stock rose 2.4% in Wednesday premarket trading after the restaurant chain reported third-quarter earnings that beat consensus and raised its full-year guidance. Net income totaled $5.9 million, or 20 cents per share, down from $6.3 million, or 21 cents per share last year. Revenue totaled $49.9 million, up from $38.2 million. The FactSet guidance was for EPS of 17 cents and revenue of $49.2 million. Domestic same-store sales grew 12.3%, ahead of the 9.6% FactSet consensus. Chief Executive Charlie Morrison said in a statement that the company has reached its 2019 goal for delivery in 80% of its domestic restaurants, which contributed to the same-store sales rise. Wingstop expects full-year domestic same-store sales to grow between 10% to 11%, up from previous guidance of high-single digit growth. And EPS is expected to be 75 cents to 77 cents, up from prior guidance for 72 cents to 74 cents. FactSet is guiding for domestic same-store sales growth of 9.5% and EPS of 73 cents. Wingstop stock is up 30.4% for the year to date while the S&P 500 index SPX, -0.08% is up 21.1% for the period.
